content:
This is terrible for reverse mode, I'm suprised it got such high approval.

I just managed to solve it with 100% on tests, but then only got 80% on validators...

The problem was Validator 3 is the only case where the rhyming part is purely composed of vowels. Also how the hell is a clash of code answer meant to recognise that "prest" rhymes with "breast", they don't have the same vowels, which makes it a hard problem to solve, especially when hidden in validators...

Validator 3 should be made much simpler at the least, but really this clash needs a statement and shouldn't be in reverse mode, imo...

In the end, it seems all you need to check to get 100% are the last two letter of each line, which is not intuitive and is quite hacky. You can't expect people to guess such a specific and arbitrary rule in reverse mode...

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'accepte cette contribution car elle convient parfaitement pour un clash.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I admit I was a bit puzzled at first, but this is a good clash. The test cases are well defined which makes it fun for a reverse mode

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very nice idea. Getting it right took me 10-15 minutes because of silly mistakes, but it should take around 5 in principle.
Seems a bit too specific for reverse mode IMO
I remember doing this in my old school days lol :), Nice idea!
